instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
hello 820-01700 after water damage near U9500 and U7220 i was clean and reball this 2.
now at the charger its give 20v but 0.05a without battery.
i notice that pp3v3_g3h_ssd is short on c9504 and c9501 i was take them both and take out also U9500 the dido mode at c9504 was 100 but after few second it show 350.
i was put back the U9500 and measure again pp3v3_g3h_ssd is still 350. i didn't put back c9504 and c9501 and connect the charger again.. on charger 20v and 1.5-2a for few second and drop down to 0.5a and the pp3v3_g3h_ssd again on diode mode 70-100ohm.
ppbus - 12.5
pp3v3_s5 -0v
pp1v8_s5 -0v

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Allow 10-15s after power removed, to check diode mode.

3V3_S5 appears at least in the first few seconds?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 68786, member: 682"]
3V3_S5 appears at least in the first few seconds?
[/QUOTE]
no.
U9500  can make this problems? i dont have new ic to check. or what board use the same?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: CPU could be now damaged, if you detected liquid spill on VCORE area...

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
There is anyway to check or its for sure that the CPU is dead? 
Any other way to check? Can U9500 make this problem? If i will replace it its can help?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: The wierd thing is When i reball the U9500(nit always) it give me the right V (20)and A(2) at the charger but when i disconnect and reconnect its gone again. V(20) A(0.05)

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
This not an exact science.
We do not have the (automatic) tools used by Apple in the fabrication line.
But liquid sign in CPU power supply is really bad.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: there is any other things that i can check?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Is the machine recognized in DFU?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 68849, member: 682"]
Is the machine recognized in DFU?
[/QUOTE]
dont know how.
 charger with battery is 19.90V and 1.5A but dead

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
We have several threads about DFU mode; just search the forum.
Too many T2 mahines get T2 corrupted and require DFU restore.

Even if previous post is so short, I don't see any reason to quote it...

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
UPDATE:
i was try DFU and RESTORE mode and i get error 35 and 4017, i dont find any info about this error.
right side charger with battery  and without 5v 0.05a
left side charger with battery 19v 1.5a without 19v 0.a

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Then you still have a problem on right side USB-C area.
Compare diode mode readings on basic points with left side.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: sorry it was the type -c adapter problem(CHINESE :mad:)...both side with battery  20.2V 1.5A without battery its 20V 0.05A.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Try again DFU with the good charger.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69105, member: 682"]
Try again DFU with the good charger.
[/QUOTE]
dont work, the mac turn on directly to RCOVERY mode, but i can access to DFU mode, and i get this errors every time.
DFU MODE: step 4 to 4 installing system- load very fast to the end the error 35.
RESTORE MODE: step 4 to 4 installing system - error 4017 at the beginning .

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Any idea?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: U7220 likely caused an overvoltage to the CPU...

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
U9500 (ssd) can caused the problem? there was there water damage... and i didnt put back C9504 AND C9501 now o put them back i sew that they CRITICAL but when i put them the PP3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS show 3.3V and at the restore its stuck at "installation system"
how can i know if U9500 is o.k or not? i dont find this IC to order new one.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
You've mentioned liquid sign at U7220 too, in the first post.

Do you get correct voltage at all coils associated with U9500?
We don't really know if T2 needs to talk with CPU to fix the NAND.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
UPDATE:
o.k i was find new water damage on U7370 i was clean and replace some components there, i was try again DFU restore but nothing..stuck on installation system and nothing on the screen and no fans.
i was also replaced U7370 but still the same.....

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: That is one of CPU power supplies; bad news...

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: dead CPU? HOW CAN I BE SURE?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: Not sure, but liquid sign in that area could be damaged PCH/CPU...

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: something that i can check?

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
You can try heating BGA chips with quality flux.
No need to melt the balls, only burn eventually accumulated crap.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
im suspect R7370 its nit look perfect can you tell me what values i need to get there? 
Without R7370 dido mode
CPUSA_ISNS_N- 945
CPUSA_ISNS_P- 1175
PPVCCA_ISNS_S0_CPU-32 short to ground
PPVCCA_CPU_R-185

with R7370 ALL SHORT

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Cannot find PPVCCA_ISNS_S0_CPU in schematic.

However, do NOT make wrong assumption.
No idea where did you get 32 ohm; but if is on a CPU power rail, that should be correct value.

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message: PPVCCSA_S0_CPU sorry

threads.title: 820-01700 water damage dead 20v 0.05a
threads.message:
Then seems to be good value.
R7370 is only 2 miliohm resistor.
Overvoltage induced there by liquid, could damaged CPU.
